results.title: Independent living centre [Italian Version]
results.brief_description: Outlines the highly specialised and unique services of the Independent Living Centre in Victoria which aims to assist people with disabilities to enhance their independence and quality of life by providing demonstrations, advice and information on a comprehensive range of aids and equipment for daily living. Narrated in Italian.

results.title: In the crash
results.creator_credit: Leo Trachtenberg, Roger Reidy, Harvest Films and Insurance Institute for Highway Safety
results.brief_description: Despite ‘accident prevention’ campaigns, millions of cars continue to crash each year. This documentary argues that legislation needs to be introduced to address better safety standards in car and highway designs. Uses footage of highway crashes, controlled safety tests, and potential highway hazards to demonstrates how injury and property damage can be reduced through design. Demonstrates features designed to reduce personal injury such as seat belts, air bags, laminated windscreens, padded daashboards, shock absorbing steering columns, anchored seats and head rests. Also looks at highway design, demonstrating good and bad examples of traffic islands, barriers, signage poles and lamp posts.

results.title: In our water
results.brief_description: South Brunswick, New Jersey; Spring, 1975. Frank Kaler and his family are convinced there is something wrong with their water; vegetables cooked in it change colour, skin lesions appear after bathing in it. The health department claims that it is drinkable, but it is later determined to be some of the most toxic drinking water in the country.

results.title: In our own backyards: uranium mining in the United States
results.creator_credit: Pamela Jones, Sussanna Styron and Eleventh Hour Films
results.brief_description: The mining and milling of uranium involves the stripping of vast areas of land, reduction of local water tables, release of radioactive gases into the air, and the creation of millions of tons of radioactive waste. This film explores the impact of this process on the environment, the health of the workers and nearby residents. Also explores social justice issues relating to exploitation of Navajo Indian workforce by the mining companies - to the detriment of the health of the native Americans so employed. Environmental health issues (affecting Navajo Indians living in the mines’ vicinity) are a further focus.

results.title: In other lands: Bohemia
results.creator_credit: Clyde E. Elliott and Post Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: The formation of the Czechoslovak Republic at the close of the World War brought together as the Czech, or Bohemian, nation the Slavs of Bohemia, Moravia and Slovakia. Czechoslovakia owes its sound financial and industrial position to men who ome of that enduring Slavic stock which for centuries has dominated Bohemia and Moravia. Shows Bohemians in traditional peasant dress and tells of the Bohemian farming peasants way of life - selling their produce at the market, attending church, celebrating a wedding, and particularly focuses on their various costume of dress. Photography by Horace C. Shimeld.

results.title: In open air: a portrait of the American impressionists
results.creator_credit: Roger Snodgrass, Paul Johnson and Smithsonian Institute
results.brief_description: A documentary about the late 19th century American Impressionists. The film reveals the nature of these artists’ sensibility and work; the specific French Impressionists from whom they drew inspiration; and the various artistic communities which they founded in America.

results.title: In a rehearsal room
results.creator_credit: David W. Hahn and Otter Productions
results.brief_description: In Paris, at the turn of the century, two young dancers meet in a rehearsal room. Warming up, each is very aware of the other. Tentatively they come together and then, caught up in the music, they dance. A blend of ballet, music and romance.

results.title: Imprint = L'Empreinte
results.creator_credit: Henri Lacam, Jacques Armand Cardon and International Film Promotions
results.brief_description: Animated philosophical tale about the moulding of children into a social pattern. Futuristic piece which suggests that society will consist of two classes - the rulers and the ruled. Suitable for upper secondary level.
